channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump calls Fauci 'a little bit of an alarmist' as coronavirus cases rise
item.description: President Donald Trump called Dr. Anthony Fauci "a little bit of an alarmist" on Sunday as the coronavirus pandemic worsens and the nation's top infectious disease expert urges elected officials to implement more health safety measures.

item.title: More than 140,000 people have died from coronavirus in the US
'He's unteachable': Doctor blasts Trump's latest mask remarks
item.description: Dr. Jonathan Reiner reacts to President Donald Trump's comments about a national mask mandate during an interview with Fox News' Chris Wallace.

item.title: The US broke its single-day record for new cases at least 9 times in a month. This is how the crisis spiraled
item.description: It's been a month of harrowing milestones set across the country, with the US beating its own daily record of total new coronavirus cases at least nine times.

item.title: How the world's second-most populated country hit 1 million coronavirus cases
Brain fog, fatigue, breathlessness. Long-term symptoms linger on for many coronavirus victims
item.description: Professional diver Emiliano Pescarolo contracted coronavirus in March and spent 17 days in hospital in the Italian port city of Genoa before being discharged on April 10.

item.title: Donald Trump is trying to lead America away from John Lewis' legacy
item.description: • Two senators post photos of Elijah Cummings instead of John Lewis on social media • New polls show Joe Biden is winning suburbanites by a historic margin • Opinion: What a Trump loss could look like

item.title: John Lewis, civil rights icon and 'conscience of Congress,' dies at 80
Why John Lewis spent his 21st birthday in jail
item.description: As Rep. John Lewis turns 80, the congressman and civil rights legend remembers the birthday that changed his life forever.

item.title: Britain is too weak to go full Trump on China
item.description: When the UK announced its U-turn on allowing the Chinese telecoms giant Huawei to play a part in the country's 5G network, it signaled an end to the so-called "golden era" of UK-China relations. To the delight of US President Donald Trump, the UK would seemingly no longer equivocate on its national security in order to balance its relationship with China -- and would instead adopt something closer to a US-style hard line.

item.title: Can a religious group that wants to bring down China's Communist Party survive in Hong Kong?
item.description: To the upbeat sounds of a blue-uniformed brass band, the rally proceeded through downtown Hong Kong.

item.title: Princess Beatrice, daughter of Prince Andrew, releases photos of her private wedding
item.description: Buckingham Palace has released photographs from the private wedding of the UK's Princess Beatrice, who married real estate developer Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi on Friday in a ceremony at Windsor Castle attended by Queen Elizabeth II.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Protesters asked to leave or risk arrest after Portland Police Association office is set ablaze
item.description: Authorities asked protesters near the Portland Police Association office to leave Saturday night or risk arrest.

item.title: Anonymous security forcing citizens into cars is mark of dictatorship
item.description: How far will President Donald Trump go to win re-election? We will only know the answer in November -- perhaps later -- but for a look at the more sinister aspects of his campaign, take a look at what is happening in Portland, Oregon, and pair it with the overarching theme of Trump's campaign ads, now trying to paint America as a raging inferno of anarchist mayhem.

item.title: Mysterious arrest video with unidentified police raises alarm
item.description: A mysterious video of unidentified police arresting a protester and putting him in an unmarked vehicle has been shared widely online, including by a US senator who called it "authoritarianism." US Customs and Border Protection says the person detained in the video was suspected of assaulting federal agents.

item.title: Olympic figure skater Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya dies at 20
item.description: Pairs figure skater Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya, who was born in Russia but competed for Australia in the 2018 Olympics, has died at 20 in Moscow, the International Skating Union reported Saturday.

item.title: A US travel ban would bar China's top billionaire entrepreneurs from America
item.description: The Trump administration is reportedly considering a ban on travel to the United States by all members of the Chinese Communist Party and their families. That could have major consequences for China's wealthiest entrepreneurs and business leaders.

item.title: India's rich can't flee the pandemic. That's given some new empathy for the poor
item.description: India passed 1 million confirmed coronavirus cases Friday, after its health ministry reported a record 34,956 new infections in just 24 hours.

item.title: State Department releases cable that helped spread claims coronavirus emerged from Chinese lab
item.description: The State Department has released a 2018 diplomatic cable noting that the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV) had "a serious shortage of appropriately trained technicians and investigators needed to safely operate this high-containment laboratory."

item.title: See the creative ways parents are trying to solve the school problem
item.description: Retail spaces, co-ops, outdoor learning: Parents are grappling with what to do with their kids this school season. Here are some alternatives they've come up with.

item.title: White House objects to Senate GOP push for more CDC money for coronavirus testing and tracing
item.description: The White House and Senate Republicans are at odds over the amount of funding that should be given to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in the next round of stimulus spending, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told CNN on Saturday.

item.title: Birx's rise at White House has hit her standing among health experts
item.description: As the relationship between Dr. Anthony Fauci and President Donald Trump publicly disintegrated over the past few months, Dr. Deborah Birx, Fauci's former mentee, solidified her standing inside the White House, to the point that sources familiar with the situation say she has essentially taken charge of running the task force day to day.

item.title: Black Lives Matter mural outside Trump Tower vandalized three times in one week
item.description: The Black Lives Matter street mural in front of Trump Tower in midtown Manhattan has been vandalized three times in one week, according to the New York Police Department.

item.title: This is the best way to honor John Lewis' legacy
item.description: There is a bridge in Selma, Alabama, where the 25-year-old John Lewis nearly died during the 1965 "Bloody Sunday" march. This bridge, named after Edmund Pettus -- a Confederate general and leader of the Alabama Ku Klux Klan -- spans the reality of America's racist foundations and the dream of a just country.

item.title: Despite recent anti-Semitic comments, Jews and Black people have long been allies
John King: We thought this was troublesome. You see the trend now
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci said that instead of focusing on a second wave of coronavirus, the US needs to focus on the alarming increase of coronavirus cases happening now.

item.title: Seven things you probably didn't know were connected to slavery
item.description: As protesters across the United States continue calling for an end to police brutality and racial injustice, organizations are coming to terms with their racist histories.

item.title: Artist donates 1,800 paintings to a hospital, one for every employee
item.description: A hospital in Brooklyn received a special delivery this week during the coronavirus pandemic: A truckload of 1,800 paintings, one for every employee, each representing a flower.

item.title: Almost all Covid-19 patients with symptoms had at least 1 of these 3, CDC survey says
item.description: Covid-19 can cause a wide variety of symptoms, but a new analysis of records by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that most patients seemed to share at least one of three symptoms: fever, cough or shortness of breath.

item.title: Doctors sound alarm over 'Covid parties'
item.description: CNN's Brian Todd investigates so-called 'Covid parties' as the number of hospitalized coronavirus patients continue to rise.

item.title: You can see Comet NEOWISE this month. Here's what we know about it
item.description: Stargazers in the Northern Hemisphere should enjoy every opportunity to see the new Comet NEOWISE as it streaks across the evening sky for the rest of July.

item.title: Marcelo Bielsa masterminds Leeds United return to Premier League
item.description: After 16 long and often painful years, fans of Leeds United have had double cause for celebration this weekend with a return to the top-flight of English football confirmed and the wrapping up of the Championship title, the club's first silverware in nearly 30 years.

item.title: Eight up for Hamilton in Hungary as Verstappen takes fine second after crash
item.description: Lewis Hamilton took the F1 championship lead as he won the Hungarian Grand Prix for the eighth time on Sunday, leading from start to finish at one of his favorite circuits.

item.title: Five ways Boeing's 747 jumbo jet changed travel
item.description: With British Airways this week retiring its fleet of Boeing 747s four years ahead of schedule, the final flying days of the planet's most recognizable jetliner are approaching sooner than expected.

item.title: Chris Evans praises boy who saved sister from dog attack
item.description: Bridger Walker, a brave 6-year-old boy who shielded his sister from an attacking dog, received a surprise message from Chris Evans - who is sending Bridger a signed Captain America shield.

item.title: Ancient human ancestors carved a handaxe from a hippo femur 1.4 million years ago, study says
item.description: Early human ancestors used advanced techniques to craft a handaxe from the femur of a hippopotamus 1.4 million years ago, according to a new study.

item.title: Stunning Great Barrier Reef island, once won in a poker game, is up for sale
item.description: A fully serviced private island in Australia's Southern Great Barrier Reef is now on the market -- just in time for those who want a place to ride out the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: The story of one woman, four men, a tiny boat and a hungry polar bear
item.description: The summer before I turned 40 -- with my fertility ebbing, as everyone with a vested interest in such things felt the need to remind me -- I decided to set sail on the biggest adventure of my life.

item.title: Journalist Jemele Hill weighs in on NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's op-ed
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to journalist Jemele Hill about an op-ed penned by former NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar on anti-semitism in sports and Hollywood.

item.title: No, NASA didn't create a 13th zodiac sign
item.description: NASA scientists do not study astrology; nor are they responsible for the creation of a little-known 13th zodiac sign.

item.title: Watch Tina Fey's pandemic-inspired '30 Rock' special
item.description: Cast members of the beloved NBC sitcom "30 Rock" got back together for a remotely filmed comedy special.

item.title: The thrill of tuk-tuk racing
item.description: Tuk-tuks are three-wheeled motor vehicles widely used in Sri Lanka and southern Asia.

item.title: England's Covid data under 'urgent review'
Trump campaign pushes Facebook ads bashing TikTok
item.description: President Donald Trump's reelection campaign pushed ads on Facebook this weekend that accuse the Chinese video app TikTok of spying on Americans.

item.title: Police used drones to monitor nudity at a Minnesota beach
item.description: Police near Minneapolis used drones last week to check if sunbathers at a lakeside beach were breaking the law by going nude or topless.

item.title: A swarm of flying ants stretched for miles over the UK and looked like rain on weather radar
item.description: You can add giant swarms of flying ants to your 2020 scary-sounding insects Bingo card alongside murder hornets and hordes of noisy cicadas.

item.title: Head of NYPD union gives Fox News interview with QAnon mug in background
item.description: The head of the New York Police Department's second-largest police union gave a television interview Friday afternoon while sitting in front of a mug emblazoned with QAnon imagery and slogans.

item.title: August Alsina drops new song 'Entanglements' after confirmed relationship with Jada Pinkett Smith
item.description: Singer August Alsina is putting his own spin on the word "entanglement" with his new song that dropped late Saturday night.
